properties.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 17 at 6:59PM CST until January 18 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Bismarck ND
properties.description:
* WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, blowing snow and
significant drifting snow expected. Additional snow
accumulations of up to two inches. Winds gusting as high as 50
mph. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills
expected. Wind chills as low as 35 below zero.

* WHERE...Bottineau, McHenry, Sheridan and Burleigh counties.

* WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until noon CST
Saturday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from noon to 6 PM CST
Saturday.

* IMPACTS...The dangerously cold wind chills will cause frostbite
on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a
hat, and gloves.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST SATURDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 6 PM CST SATURDAY
